html: The third—The third party, in that sacred league, whereby all of them oblige themselves to serve God. Egypt—These are named, because they were the most obstinate enemies to God's church, but they are here put for all the Gentiles. A blessing—This is peculiar to Israel, who is not only a third party, but is the most eminent of the three, as being the fountain, by which the blessing is conveyed to the other two; because Christ was to be born of them, and the gospel—church and ordinances were first established among them, and from them derived to the Gentiles. The land—Or, of those lands, Egypt and Assyria, between which Israel lay.
